titleStmt.title: A continued iournall of all the proceedings of the Duke of Buckingham his Grace, in the Isle of Ree, since the last of Iuly VVith the names of those noblemen as were drowned and taken in going to releeue the fort. As also the portaiture [sic] of the knife with which his Excellence should haue beene murdered: which very knife was brought ouer by Captaine Buckestone, and deliuered vnto the Dutches of Buckinghame her Grace on Monday night last. Published by authoritie.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Augustine Mathewes] for Thomas Walkley, and are to be sold at his shop at the Eagle and Childe in Britaines-Bursse,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf contains two woodcuts of ships; the folded leaf is a diagram of a knife.
The map advertised on B2r is different from STC 21590.5.
Reproduction of the original in the Huntington Library.
